data.title: The Guide to Living in Georgetown, Washington, D.C.
data.meta_description: Discover life in Georgetown, Washington, D.C. Learn more about Georgetown, Washington, D.C.’s history, explore popular sights and attractions, and browse real estate and homes for sale. Schedule your tour of Georgetown, Washington, D.C. today.
data.text:
GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.

The History of Georgetown, Washington, D.C.

With its charming row homes, quiet parks, and cobblestone streets, Georgetown stands as one of the most iconic neighborhoods in Washington, D.C.

Established in 1751, Georgetown’s location along the Potomac River has long defined the character of the community. The creation of the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal in the 1820s solidified Georgetown as an important location in early American commerce and culture.

Today, Georgetown reflects best of Washington, D.C., including world-class retail and shopping along M Street and Wisconsin Avenue, fine educational institutions such as Georgetown University, as well as distinctive row homes and historic mansions, including Hollerith House and Georgetown Square.

WHAT ARE THE BEST NEIGHBORHOODS IN GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

While Georgetown, Washington, D.C. is in itself a distinct neighborhood within the Nation’s Capital, there are nuances within this historic enclave. To begin, Georgetown, Washington, D.C. is bisected by Wisconsin Avenue into two distinct areas: The East Village and The West Village. The East Village of Georgetown, Washington, D.C. is considered the more residential and more “grand”, while The West Village is considered the more vibrant as it approaches downtown Washington, D.C. Popular neighborhoods in Georgetown, Washington, D.C. include Burleith and Glover Park, each located in Georgetown’s West Village.

WHAT IS THE SCHOOL DISTRICT FOR GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

Residents of Georgetown, Washington, D.C. attend District of Columbia Public Schools.

WHAT ARE THE BEST RESTAURANTS IN GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

As one of the most desirable neighborhoods in the Nation’s Capital, Georgetown, Washington, D.C. boasts several great restaurants. For a more upscale dining experience, Cafe Milano, Reverie, and the iconic 1789 Restaurant and Bar offer world-class culinary experiences. For a more approachable dining experience, the Peacock Cafe and Chez Billy Sud are wonderful. And for a quick bite, Chaia serves a carefully curated selection of delicious vegetarian tacos. On Wisconsin Avenue, Yellow offers innovative middle eastern dishes in a casual environment.

lS GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C A SAFE PLACE TO LIVE?

Among the many neighborhoods in Nation’s Capital, Georgetown, Washington, D.C. is among the most safe. While main thoroughfares like M Street and Wisconsin Avenue are major attractions to residents and tourists alike, the residential areas of Georgetown, Washington, D.C. are quiet, calm, and regarded as some of the most beautiful in the Mid-Atlantic.

WHAT ARE THE TOP SIGHTS AND ATTRACTIONS IN GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

As one of the most popular destinations in the Mid-Atlantic, Georgetown, Washington, D.C. offers world-class entertainment, retail, and cultural attractions. Along Wisconsin Avenue and M Street, restaurants and retail abound. Heading south towards the Potomac River, The Georgetown Waterfront offers an idyllic setting for an afternoon walk or cocktail. Consider visiting Dumbarton Oaks Museum for a quiet moment and visiting the famous Exorcist Stairs for a photo opportunity.

HOW MUCH DOES IT COST TO BUY A HOME IN GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

The median sale price for a single family home in Georgetown, Washington, D.C. is $1,110,000, which is almost four times higher than the national average of $308,980. Ready to buy the home of your dreams? Browse homes for sale in Georgetown, Washington, D.C. presented by Sotheby’s International Realty.

WHEN IS THE GEORGETOWN HOUSE TOUR?

Each year, The Georgetown House Tour gives locals and visitors alike the opportunity to visit 18th and 19th century historic homes. The Georgetown House Tour will take place on Saturday, April 20th from 11:00 AM - 5:00 PM.

WHAT IS THE PROPERTY TAX RATE FOR GEORGETOWN, WASHINGTON, D.C.?

Property taxes for Georgetown, Washington, D.C. are calculated per every $100 of assessed value. For 2024, the rate is $0.85.
